intro: Stachys latidens, commonly known as broadleaf hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, forming dense, spiky inflorescences that bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks.
